page.title: 17COUNTRY INNS OF CLANFIELD
page.content: The only inn in the area, the Hog's Lodge has been a hostelry for centuries,although the original building was destroyed by fire and the present structure, erected on an adjacent site, dates from only 1927.It caters for a wide range of customers including businessmen during the week and families especially at weekends. There is a well equipped playground for children. Locally brewed ales are a speciality and a varied menu is offered for lunch_time and evening meals,served at the bar or in the spacious dining room.The recently improved A3 trunk road now by_passes the inn but in spite of this the trade has increased.It has gained the reputation of being a quiet country pub with an historic background.
